src:
Srpski odbojkaši počinju borbu za plasman na Olimpijske igre protiv Francuske
Određen sastav grupa i raspored mečeva na poslednjem kvalifikacionom turniru

01 Nov 2019

Evropski šampioni su saznali imena rivala i raspored utakmica u borbi za plasman na Olimpijske Igre.
Odbojkaši Srbije imaju još jednu šansu da izvade olimpijsku vizu za Tokio, ali put nije nimalo lak.
Na kvalifikacionom olimpijskom turniru koji će se od 5. do 10. januara održati u Berlinu, srpski odbojkaši će se boriti sa još sedam ozbiljnih selekcija za prvo mesto koje vodi na Olimpijske igre. Samo pobednik tunira ide u Tokio, a evropske šampione očekuju jako ozbiljni rivali.
Srbija će u B grupi sa Francuskom, Bugarskom i Holandijom, a u A grupi će igrati domaćin Nemačka, Belgija, Slovenija i Češka, saopštio je CEV. Srbija će prvi meč u dvorani “Maks Šmeling” odigrati u nedelju, 5. januara protiv Francuske od 13.30 časova. U ponedeljak, 6. januara će igrati protiv Holandije od 14.00 časova, a posle slobodnog dana će treći meč odigrati u sredu, 8. januara protiv Bugarske od 17.00 časova. Plasman u polufinale izboriće dve prvoplasirane selekcije iz obe grupe, a plasman na OI 2020. u Tokiju izboriće samo pobednik.
Dakle, Srbiju već na startu očekuje najteži mogući ispit na truniru – Francuska! Jedna od najjačih svetskih ekipa je godinama bila nerešiva enigma za našu reprezentaciju, ali je ova generacija naših odbojkaša uspela da na poslednja dva velika takmičenja savlada Trikolore. Poslednji put na nedavnom Evropskom prvenstvu u Francuskoj kada je Srbija usred Pariza šokirala favorizovanog domaćina.



Ne treba potecniti ni opasne Bugare, dok su Holanđani na papiru najslabija ekipa u grupi, ali imaju nadolazeću generaciju koja bi mogla da igra ozbiljnu ulogu narednih godina. U drugoj grupi su favoriti domaćin Nemačka i evropski vicešampion Slovenija, Belgija će vrebati iz senke dok su Česi potpuni autsajderi.
Podsetimo, Srbija nije uspela da izbori plasman kroz letnji kvalifikacioni turnir za Olimpijske igre kada je u Bariju poražena od domaćina Italije. Sa druge strane, Francuzi su na svom kvalifikacionom turniru izgubili od Poljske.
U januaru nač čekaju novi odbojkaški trileri i nademo se palsman naše reprezentacije u Tokio. Na OI 2020. u konkurenciji odbojkaša igraće Japan, organizator, Brazil, SAD, Italija, Poljska, Rusija i Argentina, kao i pobednici pet Kontinentalnih turnira.
Istovremeno, CEV je odredio i sastav grupa i raspored mečeva za poslednji ženski kvalifikacioni turnira za plasman u Tokio. Naše devojke su taj posao odradile još letos i plasirale se u Tokio, a poslednji kvalifikacioni turnir se igra u holandskom Apeldornu od 7. do 12. januara. U A grupi će igrati domaćin Holandija, Bugarska, Poljska i Azerbejdžan, a u B grupi Turska, Nemačka, Belgija i Hrvatska. Plasman na OI 2020. (24. jul – 9. avgust) u Tokiju izboriće pobednik turnira. Favoriti na turniru su Holandija i Turska.
(FOTO: CEV)
text:
Serbian volleyball players begin the fight to qualify for the Olympics against France
The composition of the groups and the schedule of matches at the last qualifying tournament

01 Nov 2019

European champions have learned the names of rivals and the schedule of matches in the fight for the Olympic Games.
Serbia's volleyball players have another chance to get an Olympic visa for Tokyo, but the road is not at all easy.
In the qualifying Olympic tournament, which will take place in Berlin from January 5 to 10, the Serbian volleyball players will contend with seven more serious selections for the first place leading to the Olympic Games. Only the winner of the tournament goes to Tokyo, and European champions expect very serious rivals.
Serbia will play in Group B with France, Bulgaria and the Netherlands, and host Group A will host Germany, Belgium, Slovenia and the Czech Republic, the CEV said. Serbia will play its first match at the Max Schmeling Hall on Sunday, January 5th against France at 1.30pm. On Monday, January 6th they will play against the Netherlands from 14.00, and after the day off, the third match will be played on Wednesday, January 8 against Bulgaria from 17.00. Placing in the semifinals will select two first-placed selections from both groups, and placing in the 2020 Olympics in Tokyo will only pick the winner.
So, Serbia is facing the toughest possible exam on the start - France! One of the strongest teams in the world has been an unsolvable enigma for our national team for years, but this generation of our volleyball players has managed to defeat Tricolor in the last two major competitions. The last time at the recent European Championships in France when Serbia shocked a favored host in the middle of Paris.



The dangerous Bulgarians are not to be mentioned, with the Dutch on paper being the weakest team in the group, but they have an upcoming generation that could play a serious role in the coming years. In the second group, favorites are host Germany and European vice-champion Slovenia, Belgium will lurk out of the shadows while the Czechs are complete outsiders.
Recall that Serbia failed to win the placement through the summer qualifying tournament for the Olympic Games when it was defeated by host Italy in Bari. On the other hand, the French lost to Poland in their qualifying tournament.
In January, new volleyball thrillers await and hopefully our national team palsman in Tokyo. In the 2020 Olympics, Japan, the organizer, Brazil, the United States, Italy, Poland, Russia and Argentina will play volleyball competition, as well as winners of five Continental tournaments.
At the same time, CEV determined the composition of the groups and the schedule of matches for the last women's qualifying tournament in Tokyo. Our girls did the job this summer and moved to Tokyo, with the last qualifying tournament being played in Dutch Apeldoorn from January 7-12. The A group will host the Netherlands, Bulgaria, Poland and Azerbaijan, and the B group will host Turkey, Germany, Belgium and Croatia. Placement at the 2020 Olympics (July 24 - August 9) in Tokyo will pick the winner of the tournament. The tournament favorites are the Netherlands and Turkey.
(PHOTO: TUBE)
